channel.title: Free webclient host
channel.description:
hello guys,
i want to upload my client.jar to a webhost to make my webclient but webs.com doesn't work anymore. who knows one that works?

item.title: Free webclient host
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“my-swagger, post:10, topic:552309”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=671225.msg4489575#msg4489575 date=1436718591]

Write a simple web server and host it using your computer
[/quote]Why write one?

Why not? It’s fairly simple if he’s just hosting a web client.
Just look at Scapeemu for example :)[/quote]

Unless you’re writing it in Node then this is especially easy but otherwise it just seems unnecessary imo.

Read full topic

item.title: Free webclient host
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:7, topic:552309”][quote author=Justin Bieber link=topic=671225.msg4488867#msg4488867 date=1436105970]
just put it in a public s3 bucket
[/quote]
While free under certain circumstances, it won’t always be free.[/quote]
worst case it’s not going to be any more than a dollar a month… as an example it’s 1 cent for every 25,000 requests and an additional 9 cents per GB downloaded. I’d much rather pay cents for my hosting and get something reliable and fast with good support. if you end up paying out mega bucks for s3 then you probably need the capacity to serve your users, and should be working on how to monetise.

[quote=“maul ownz, post:6, topic:552309”][quote author=Justin Bieber link=topic=671225.msg4488969#msg4488969 date=1436165229]
or just upload it to s3 and never have to worry about downtime and scalability again
[/quote]i don’t know how that works, do i need to upload my client.jar to s3?[/quote]
yup. just sign up for AWS, log in to the AWS console, go to S3, create a bucket, then upload the file.

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/UG/UploadingObjectsintoAmazonS3.html

you can even host an entire static website from s3 - http://docs.aws.amazon.com/gettingstarted/latest/swh/website-hosting-intro.html

Read full topic
